channel.title: [Solved] Need help with <ruby> tag in Java/JTextPane [Solved]
channel.description:
I wish to use the <ruby> tag in some kind of Java text field/pane/box. I tried this: [code=scala]var panel = new JTextPane(); panel.setContentType("text/html"); panel.setText("""<ruby>一人<rp>(</rp><rt>ひとり</rt><rp>)</rp></ruby>""")[/code] [size=8pt](I'm doing this is scala, but that doesn't matter as it is a Java class I'm using).[/size]
This doesn't work, JTextPane doesn't render it properly at all. Searching for anything on Google doesn't give me much either as Google thinks I want information on the programming language Ruby. So does anyone know how to fix this or any other way of rendering HTML in java that supports this tag?
[b][size=10pt]EDIT: Using JavaFX fixed the problem.[/size][/b]

item.source: [Solved] Need help with <ruby> tag in Java/JTextPane [Solved]

item.title: [Solved] Need help with <ruby> tag in Java/JTextPane [Solved]
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

And you call yourself a Java Guru? All the J… components support HTML if you use the tag and JTextPane support it if you set contenttype to “text/html”.

EDIT: Use JavaFX’s HTMLEditor or WebView if you want to use HTML5 in your Java applications. JavaFX uses Webkit and thus have much more functionality than Swing.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Yes I tried with encasing too. It isn’t necessary in JTextPane since you specify content type.

EDIT: I’m trying JavaFX’s HTMLEditor now in hope that it has better HTML5 support.

Read full topic

item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

I wish to use the tag in some kind of Java text field/pane/box.
I tried this:

var panel = new JTextPane(); panel.setContentType("text/html"); panel.setText("""<ruby>一人<rp>(</rp><rt>ひとり</rt><rp>)</rp></ruby>""")
[size=8pt](I’m doing this is scala, but that doesn’t matter as it is a Java class I’m using).[/size]

This doesn’t work, JTextPane doesn’t render it properly at all. Searching for anything on Google doesn’t give me much either as Google thinks I want information on the programming language Ruby. So does anyone know how to fix this or any other way of rendering HTML in java that supports this tag?

[size=10pt]EDIT: Using JavaFX fixed the problem.[/size]
